New Records: Denmark thought they scored an early goal but it was ruled offside by VAR.
Joachim Andersen's own goal was disallowed due to the ball being out of play.
Aleksandar Mitrovic had several chances but missed the target, including one in the 81st minute.
Predrag Rajkovic made three key saves to keep Serbia in the game.
Key Match Events: Denmark dominated with 10 shots to Serbia's zero in the first 70 minutes.
Serbia had a late chance to win but Mitrovic missed the opportunity.
Serbia took control towards the end but couldn't score the decisive goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Denmark progressed to the knockout rounds despite the goalless draw.
Serbia ended the tournament with two points from three matches, securing third place over Slovenia.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rated with 3/5 stars in the match rating.
